items.sentence: Getting the right people to help us will be difficult.
I'm sure that Tom would love to go to Boston with you.
We have a lot of reasons why we don't want to do that.
There are more clouds today than there were yesterday.
The sunny side of the hill is full of deciduous trees.
My parents were the ones who taught me how to do that.
Nothing we asked Tom to do will be hard for him to do.
Is it true that Tom was able to swim across the river?
Tom told Mary that it was her turn to wash the dishes.
Some older kids beat me up on my way home from school.
Tom can't actually do that even though he says he can.
Tom called Mary's high school to see if she was there.
Tom asked the guy at the gas station to check his oil.
When I entered Tom's room, I found him reading a book.
When Tom turned up, we'd been waiting for three hours.
They were speaking a language that I didn't recognize.
It took me a long time to find what I was looking for.
How many times a week does the football team practice?
Tom knows that he has to do what Mary tells him to do.
Tom will have plenty of time to read after he retires.
